title: Maximizing Research Skills: Finding Reliable Sources
story: Miss, you have been using the computer for over an hour now. I know, I'm sorry. Are you looking for something? I'm researching for my project. Can you come back tomorrow? Your daily computer limit time is up. I don't have a computer at home. I'm sorry to hear that, but other people need to use the computer, too. My project is due very soon. I need to research. How about books? This is a library after all. I looked for books on my project. They're not good at all. Maybe you don't know how to look for good books. I'll help you. Thank you. I appreciate it.
summary: A student is struggling to find reliable sources for their project and seeks help from the librarian in finding good books as an alternative to computer research.
image: An image of a student sitting at a library desk, surrounded by books and using a laptop.
